intro: Acetosa nebroides, commonly known as the clouded sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes species known for their distinctive leaf shapes and edible properties. The plant features broad, heart-shaped leaves with a waxy surface and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. Acetosa nebroides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky outcrops. Its botanical characteristics make it a unique and relatively rare species within its native habitat.
